connector.description: Interact with jBPM workflow engine over REST.

camel.source.path.connectionURL.name: camel.source.path.connectionURL
camel.source.path.connectionURL.description: The URL to the jBPM server.

camel.source.path.eventListenerType.name: camel.source.path.eventListenerType
camel.source.path.eventListenerType.description: Sets the event listener type to attach to

camel.source.endpoint.attachmentId.name: camel.source.endpoint.attachmentId
camel.source.endpoint.attachmentId.description: attachId to use when retrieving attachments

camel.source.endpoint.contentId.name: camel.source.endpoint.contentId
camel.source.endpoint.contentId.description: contentId to use when retrieving attachments

camel.source.endpoint.emitterSendItems.name: camel.source.endpoint.emitterSendItems
camel.source.endpoint.emitterSendItems.description: Sets if event produced by emitter should be sent as single items or complete collection

camel.source.endpoint.event.name: camel.source.endpoint.event
camel.source.endpoint.event.description: the data associated with this event when signalEvent operation is performed

camel.source.endpoint.eventType.name: camel.source.endpoint.eventType
camel.source.endpoint.eventType.description: the type of event to use when signalEvent operation is performed

camel.source.endpoint.maxNumber.name: camel.source.endpoint.maxNumber
camel.source.endpoint.maxNumber.description: the maximum number of rules that should be fired

camel.source.endpoint.page.name: camel.source.endpoint.page
camel.source.endpoint.page.description: The page to use when retrieving user tasks

camel.source.endpoint.pageSize.name: camel.source.endpoint.pageSize
camel.source.endpoint.pageSize.description: The page size to use when retrieving user tasks

camel.source.endpoint.processId.name: camel.source.endpoint.processId
camel.source.endpoint.processId.description: the id of the process that should be acted upon

camel.source.endpoint.processInstanceId.name: camel.source.endpoint.processInstanceId
camel.source.endpoint.processInstanceId.description: the id of the process instance

camel.source.endpoint.targetUserId.name: camel.source.endpoint.targetUserId
camel.source.endpoint.targetUserId.description: The targetUserId used when delegating a task

camel.source.endpoint.task.name: camel.source.endpoint.task
camel.source.endpoint.task.description: The task instance to use with task operations

camel.source.endpoint.userId.name: camel.source.endpoint.userId
camel.source.endpoint.userId.description: userId to use with task operations

camel.source.endpoint.value.name: camel.source.endpoint.value
camel.source.endpoint.value.description: the value to assign to the global identifier

camel.source.endpoint.workItemId.name: camel.source.endpoint.workItemId
camel.source.endpoint.workItemId.description: the id of the work item

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.source.endpoint.synchronous
camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used

camel.source.endpoint.entities.name: camel.source.endpoint.entities
camel.source.endpoint.entities.description: The potentialOwners when nominateTask operation is performed

camel.source.endpoint.extraJaxbClasses.name: camel.source.endpoint.extraJaxbClasses
camel.source.endpoint.extraJaxbClasses.description: To load additional classes when working with XML

camel.source.endpoint.parameters.name: camel.source.endpoint.parameters
camel.source.endpoint.parameters.description: the variables that should be set for various operations

camel.source.endpoint.statuses.name: camel.source.endpoint.statuses
camel.source.endpoint.statuses.description: The list of status to use when filtering tasks

camel.component.jbpm.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.component.jbpm.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.jbpm.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.jbpm.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.jbpm.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.jbpm.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
